content: tunisian cocoon shrug by hayley joanne robinson a comfortable cocoon shrug with a contrasting tunisian reverse stitch border and sleeve detail made from a single rectangle which is then sewn together to create a cocoon shrug © 2018 hayley joanne robinson materials 7 0mm tunisian crochet hook approximately 1380 yards of aran yarn row counter gauge 13st x 12 row = 10cm/4 inches2 abbreviations chain = chain st = stitch es trs = tunisian reverse stitch tss = tunisian simple stitch slip_stitch = slip_stitch width of textured border 6 5cm/2 5 inches sleeve circumference s e h 33cm/13 inches h c t n g n i 5 e l 6 y 3 / d m o b c 5 2 9 bod y width 99cm/39 inches © 2018 hayley joanne robinson pattern chain 130 next 8st tss in the next 112st trs to end foundation row pull up a loop in the back 130 of the 2nd chain from hook and each chain to end return 130 loops on hook repeat row 3 39 more times return row 4 skip the 1st vertical bar tss to end row 1 skip the 1st vertical bar trs to end 130 130 return return repeat row 4 28 more times repeat row 1 7 more times to complete row 5 skip the 1st vertical bar trs to end border 130 row 2 skip the 1st vertical bar tss to end return 130 repeat row 5 6 more times to complete return border repeat row 2 28 more times slip_stitch across as for trs row 3 skip the 1st vertical bar trs in the fasten_off assembly with wrong side facing fold the upper right and lower right corners inwards to meet each other sew from where the corners meet along to the start of the tunisian reverse stitch fold the upper left corner and lower left corner inwards to meet each other sew from where the corners meet along to the start of the tunisian reverse stitch weave in ends © 2018 hayley joanne robinson
